Are you a skilled communicator adept at dealing with staff and the public at all levels? Do you make exceptional customer service your daily mission as you manage competing interests, deadlines and priorities on your own? If your answer is “absolutely”, the City of Toronto has three Executive Assistant vacancies for you: two in our Deputy City Managers' Offices and one supporting Chief Financial Officer & Treasurer.
As
Executive Assistant to the Deputy City Manager
/
Chief Financial Officer & Treasurer
,
you will provide support to the senior management team, in addition to the Deputy City Manager/Chief Financial Officer & Treasurer, on key service organization initiatives, Governance, Council/Committee structure and protocol, as well as the interpretation or application of Corporate/Service area policies and procedures.
Comfortable operating within a complex organization like the City of Toronto, you will act as the primary contact for the Office, providing liaison between the Deputy City Manager/Chief Financial Officer & Treasurer and General Managers/Executive Directors, Agencies, Boards, Commissions and Committees. At the same time, you’ll be building business relationships with the Mayor’s staff, City Councillors and their staff, Internal Auditor, Auditor General, Ombudsman, Provincial and Federal contacts. With a focus on customer service excellence, adept at working with diverse populations, and a commitment to the organizational values of reconciliation, equity, inclusion, accessibility and respect for human rights, you will also respond to enquiries from staff at all levels, officials from other levels of government and municipalities, school boards, not-for-profit organizations and other interest groups, the media and the general public.
Proactive in anticipating needs, planning ahead and determining next steps, and aware of diverse interests and conflicting priorities typical of a multi-stakeholder environment, you will also identify contentious emerging issues, provide timely, accurate and comprehensive briefings to the Deputy City Manager/Chief Financial Officer & Treasurer on such issues, and work directly with senior staff to find workable solutions. At times, we might rely on you as you provide vacation coverage for the Executive Assistant to the City Manager.
With your extensive experience in providing administrative support at the senior executive level, in a fast-paced corporate environment, managing a complex calendar, scheduling functions and adjusting to meet last-minute priorities, you have exhibited an ability to handle extremely sensitive and confidential matters with a high level of professionalism, flexibility, discretion, judgement, diplomacy and tact. Technically proficient and an excellent communicator, you also have an extensive experience preparing and drafting standard correspondence and reports, as well as editing and formatting complex reports, correspondence, charts, tables and statements for senior management.
You enjoy and often prefer working independently, with limited supervision and guidance, successfully prioritizing and managing multiple tasks and your own time, yet demonstrate outstanding customer service skills, with a strong desire to assist others, and the ability to establish rapport and foster a team-based environment. A strong problem-solver, skilled in using innovation and initiative to resolve any conflicts, you can communicate easily and persuasively at all levels of the organization – from front-line staff and senior management to elected officials – and with a wide range of external contacts.
Highly adaptable, approachable, able to think on your feet, quickly adjust to changing conditions and priorities, and proficient with various software programs (including MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint and complex calendaring systems) you are well prepared to excel in this multi-faceted administrative role.
